page.title: 16Technology new and old
page.content: Portculis groove remains at Hemyock Castle show us a modern technology of 800 years ago,but still used today. This groove tells of a large gate, chain,a windlass and perhaps gears man-powered from the adjacent towers. The home beyond contains 1980s technology.For example a heat pump heats domestic hot water. This not well-understood device hangs in the roof space and pumps heat into water. During day or night, sunshine or rain it continues to operate.Its virtue lies in the fact that for energy 1Kw consumed, 3 Kw is actually put into the water.In other words water can be heated over 24 hours at cheap rate fuel prices.The wonder lies in the simple process of the refrigerator being used in reverse. The loft air is cooled and the heat gained is pumped into the hot water system.
